She is a great defender on the ball and also gets a fair number of steals from her help-side positioning. [caption id="attachment_46883" align="alignright" width="201"] Elecia Patton set the state record for steals in a single game this year with 19. (Photo Credit: Wilmington News Journal)[/caption] Elecia Patton – Blanchester – Class of 2022 Patton burst onto the scene as the county’s top freshman during the 2018-2019 campaign. She is an explosive/volume scorer who gets a number of her points in transitions off of steals. She is dangerous from 3-point range and is also solid at the FT line. Elecia should continue to get better at taking care of the basketball as she gets older and settles into a lead-guard role. Karlie Morgan – Wilmington – 5’10 Post – Class of 2020 Morgan is a big and strong power forward/center who has a nose for rebounding at a high level. She is usually one of the toughest kids on the floor and has no problem finishing through contact around the rim. When she has a true “big” on her – she will step out and shoot the 3 at a high percentage.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Union County?

item.title: Gallia County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

Gallia County was formed in 1803 by pieces of Adams County and Washington County. Gallia County was settled by French immigrants from Gaul – hence the name Gallia County. It doesn’t feature many high schools with girls basketball, but it does have some good players returning to the courts next year.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Gallia County.

[caption id="attachment_47175" align="alignleft" width="260"] Gallia Academy could count on Maddy Petro to give them a double-double on most nights during the 2018-2019 season. (Photo Credit: Pomeroy Daily Sentinel)[/caption]

Maddy Petro – Gallia Academy – 5’9 Post – Class of 2021

Maddy was a walking double-double during her sophomore season, averaging 11.3 points and 10.5 rebounds per game. The undersized post uses her motor and athleticism to get the job done. One of the more active players on the court each night, Petro blocks a lot of shots and steals a lot of passes around the paint.

Jessie Rutt – South Gallia – 5’6 Guard – Class of 2022

Only a freshman, Rutt was her team’s best player during the 2018-2019 season. The point guard does it all. She scored nearly 14 PPG on the year, while also grabbing a handful of rebounds, creating easy scoring opportunities for her teammates and setting the tone of the defensive end for South Gallia. She is a good 3-point shooter.

Hannah Jacks – River Valley – 5’8 Forward – Class of 2021

Jacks is a guard/forward “tweener” who does a nice job of working mismatches on the offensive end. A tough kid, Hannah averaged over 8 rebounds last year to go with her 11 points per game. Although she isn’t a point guard, she has no problem handling the ball against pressure and does a nice job of finishing around the basket with both hands.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Gallia County?

item.title: Richland County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

When it comes to high school girls basketball talent, Richland County is one of the deepest locations in North Central Ohio. With a dozen high schools of all different sizes, Richland County is typically full of teams that win conference tournaments and make deep post-season runs. Although a number of players from their schools graduated and will be furthering their basketball careers at the next level, there is still plenty of talent left in Mansfield and the surrounding areas.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Richland County.

[caption id="attachment_47401" align="alignleft" width="300"] Sydney Cavanaugh can score from anywhere on the court. (Photo Credit: Richland Source)[/caption] Sydney Cavanaugh - Mansfield St. Peter's - 6'0 Guard - Class of 2020  Cavanaugh can flat out put the ball in the basket. Although she saw a number of junk defenses, playing with a very young team last year at Mansfield St. Peter's, Sydney can score in a variety of ways. At over 6'0, she has no problem posting up or backing down smaller defenders. She is a dead-eye catch-and-shoot kid from mid-range and 3-point range. She has developed as an above-average  rebounder. Avery Coleman - Lexington - 5'11 Post - Class of 2021 Avery is a very raw post player. It is clear when you watch her that she has a ton of untapped potential. She is an athlete right now who is playing basketball. An elite rebounder, Coleman grabbed over 20 caroms in multiple games during the 2018-2019 season for Lexington. Her post game is not polished and she needs to give more consistent effort - if she does, she is a big-time prospect. JayJahnae Feagin - Mansfield Senior - 5'10 Forward - Class of 2020  Feagin is a nice offensive weapon with mismatch potential. She has turned into a "point-forward" who can bring the ball down the court and initiate the offense when needed. She is a good 3-point shooter, who can hit the trifecta off of the bounce or in catch-and-shoot situations. JayJahnae is at her best when she is posting up and working against smaller defenders on the block. She is a good rebounder, as well. Kenedi Goon - Crestview - 6'1 Post - Class of 2021 Goon is one of the top basketball players in North Central Ohio, although volleyball may be her best sport and is probably the sport that she will choose to pursue at the collegiate level. She is a quick leaper who can score with either hand on the block. Kenedi will also catch and face, where she can take a dribble or two if needed. She is an excellent shot blocker who can control a game defensively. [caption id="attachment_47402" align="alignright" width="203"] Jessie Grover is one of Ohio's top players in Division 4. (Photo Credit: Bucyrus Telegraph Forum)[/caption] Jessie Grover - Lucas - 5'8 Forward - Class of 2020 Grover has helped transform Lucas from bottom-dweller status to one of the top D4 teams in the area. She is a 1000 point scorer and 2-time All-Ohioan. A physical wing, Grover constantly attacks defenses. It is not uncommon for her to take double-digit free throw attempts in a game, as she also makes her way to the foul line by grabbing a high number of offensive rebounds. Kat Leeper - Crestview - 5'8 Guard - Class of 2020 Leeper is an outstanding athlete who is really beginning to come into her own as a basketball player. She can shoot the 3 and score off of the dribble around the rim and in the mid-range. She is a great defender who can guard multiple positions. Kat is at her best in an up-tempo game. Sophia Niese - Shelby - 5'5 Guard - Class of 2022 Niese is the lone freshman on our list, after bursting onto the scene and earning all-league and all-district honors for the Whippets during her first season. She is one of the top playmakers in the area, averaging nearly 4 assists per contest. She is also a good pressure defender and can knock down an open jumper when her teammates are double-teamed. Although she primarily played point guard, she does have combo guard potential. Carleigh Pearson - Ontario - 5'6 Guard - Class of 2021  Pearson has one of the highest ceilings of all of the players on the list today. She is a true combo-guard who can get double-digit assists as the primary ball-handler or score 25 in the scoring role. Carleigh uses her athleticism to get to the rim at will, although she is probably more effective at this point in her career as a jump shooter. She has extended range on her 3-ball and makes a high percentage of her attempts. [caption id="attachment_47405" align="alignleft" width="179"] Emma Randall could be the best player in Richland County. (Photo Credit: Mansfield News Journal)[/caption] Emma Randall - Shelby - 6'0 Guard - Class of 2020 Shelby had Richland County's best team in 2018-2019 and their best player may have been Emma Randall. Randall is a long and lanky guard with a great finishing package at the rim using both hands. She is a good rebounder who will often times grab a defensive board and go coast-to-coast. She blocks a lot of shots and has a high release on 3-point jumper, which allows her to get it off anytime that she wants. Jenna Wolford - Temple Christian - 5'7 Guard - Class of 2020  At times, Wolford gets overshadowed because she attends the area's smallest HS, however that shouldn't be the case. Her 41-point explosion against Fredericktown introduced her to area fans who may not have been familiar with her before. The multi-sport standout is a slasher with great court vision. She is constantly attacking the rim and does a nice job of converting her free throws at a high rate.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Richland County?

item.title: Coshocton County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

Coshocton County has been translated from the Delaware Indian language as “union of waters” and “black bear crossing”. It is believed that Chief Newcomer – an important ally to the Continental forces in the American Revolutionary War - was the founder of Coshocton County. World Series winning manager Bob Brenly is also from Coshocton County – as are a number of great high school girls basketball players.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Coshocton County.

[caption id="attachment_47409" align="alignleft" width="250"] Kalie Rettos is an outstanding shooter. (Photo Credit: Newcomerstown News)[/caption] Kalie Rettos – Ridgewood – 5’7 Guard – Class of 2020 Rettos is one of the best shooters in the area. She has walk-in-the-gym range and is especially effective in catch-and-shoot situations. A good athlete, Rettos is solid defensively guarding any of the 3 guard spots. She is a high IQ player whose game should translate well to the D3 level if she chooses to continue her career upon graduation. Jessica Hartstock – River View – 5’7 Guard – Class of 2020 Hartstock has tremendous range on her jumper. She is a very good 3-point shooter who can hit from deep off of the bounce, as well as standing still. She is a good ball-handler who rarely forces anything and does a good job of getting hear teammates involved. She is a great athlete who still has a lot of potential. Keeley Murray – Coshocton – 5’3 Guard – Class of 2022 The point guard is a great athlete who lettered in 3 different sports during her freshmen year at Coshocton. Keeley attacks defenses well and has a nice mid-range game. A good passer and creator, Murray is also a good defender typically guards the other team’s best guard. Kelsie Stephens – Ridgewood – 5’11 Post – Class of 2022 Stephens had a solid freshman season for Ridgewood. The post should continue to develop as an offensive threat – she currently can step out to 15 feet and knock down jumpers. She does most of her damage in transition, beating slower and less athletic posts up and down the court. She is a good rebounder and has the potential to be a great rim protector.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Coshocton County?

item.title: Program Notes: Tree of Hope (Nike EYBL)
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded: The NCAA Certified, End of the Trail (EOT) West Coast Spring Showcase tournament being hosted by EOT and Elite is Earned will be held this weekend at Auburn area high schools.  Many top-level AAU teams will be showcased at the event such as Cal Stars, NW Stars, Idaho Hoop Dreams and Tree of Hope- Nike EYBL. This week we stopped by the Tree of Hope- Nike EYBL practice to gain some insight on the rising stars of the program and players that should get some notable attention this weekend. TOH- Nike EYBL (15U) is loaded with high-level, extremely skilled players that played big rolls on their high school teams this last season or will do so this year. Jazmyn “Jazzy” Stone (#44 Guard) Annie Wright High School (2022) 5’6” Jazzy has exceptional vision of the court that she pairs with mature ball handling skills that allows her to easily orchestrate the offense and single handedly control the pace of the game.  She has the presence of mind to wait for players to get in their proper positions before initiating the offense but can also take off in transition and score at will.   She had a great tournament at the Boo Williams Invite in Virginia, where she averaged 12.5 points, 4 rebounds, 3 assists and 3 steals. Lauren Glazier (#21 Wing/Forward) - Mt. Si High School (2022) 6’3” Lauren is another rising star to watch on the 15U EYBL team. She stands at a lengthy 6’3” and her versatility and dominance require respect. She can effortlessly snag rebounds and push the ball in the open court, while also showing a evolving ability to post up or drag her defender to the wing and shoot lights out behind the 3-point line in the halfcourt. Her ability to handle the ball is also something that you don’t see often with a player of her size. Navaeh Talbert (#12 Guard) ASA Middle School- 5’5” Naveah is only an 8th grader, but is already known as being one of the best shooters and creators on the team.  At the Boo Williams Invite, she averaged 13 points with a high of 21 against the Carolina Flames.   Tree of Hope- Nike 16U (Class of 2021) is also loaded with talent. Charlee Arthur (#35 Guard/Wing) Newport High School (5’10”)     Named to the Kingo 4A 2nd Team All-League her sophomore year, Charlee is a lock down shooter, intense defender and one of the hardest working players on the court.   If you give Charlee any sort of space, she is either going to pop a 3 or take her defender off the dribble and draw the foul.  Charlee also prides herself on being a lock down defender and often takes the assignment of matching up with the other teams’ best player.  She is a natural leader with high IQ which makes her a genuine extension of the coach on the court.     Molly Moffitt (#42 Forward/Post) Seattle Prep High School (6’) Molly is an athletic forward/post that can run the floor like a guard.  She is versatile in that she can see the floor and zip a pass down court or she can play with her back to the basket and battle down low. She also has a quick first step that allows her to successfully drive off the high post. She is a player that exudes confidence and plays with high intensity and doesn’t need outside motivation to play hard—she just does!   The 17U-EYBL has a roster full of stars and can pack a gym of fans and college scouts. Some of the players don’t even need introductions, such as Hailey Van Lith (Cashmere, MVP CTL 1A), Delayah Daniels (Garfield, Metro MVP), Meghan Fiso (Garfield, 1st Team Metro, Michigan) and Jordyn Jenkins (Kentridge-MVP NPSL). Some other notable players that should be on the radar this summer include: Elli Boni (#5 Guard) University High School (5’10”) Boni was named first team all-league in the Greater Spokane 4A/3A league.  She is a is quick guard that shoots the ball with range, relentlessly pursues every rebound and dives on lose balls.  She also has great footwork and can read counters to the defense. Sela Heide (#9 Post) Mt. Si High School (6’8”)   Named second team all KingCo 4A, Sela has spent countless hours in the gym working on her footwork, dribbling and shooting skills. She is starting to appreciate that her size is her strength and that she can use it to leverage against her opponent. Not only is she a nightmare defender in the paint, she is also a skilled rebounder and passer, especially on long outlets. Her dedication to time spent in the gym outside of practice is reflecting in her game. Aaliya Alexander (#6 Guard) Beamer High School (5’8”) She was named MVP and All Defensive player in the NPSL 4A this year, and for good reason.  She is a defensive leader on the court through her intensity and smarts, and can consistently be heard communicating with her teammates.  She rotates quickly on D and also has an innate ability that when a shot goes up, she gets her player boxed out early.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Get to know some of TOH's most compelling prospects!

item.title: Welcome to Prep Girls Hoops California
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded: Welcome, California girls basketball players, coaches, families and fans, to PGH California! We couldn’t be more excited to launch a website that will work tirelessly to bring exposure to talented California basketball players of ALL levels. If you’re a prospect with a shot at playing at the Division I, Division II, Division III, NAIA or junior-college levels, we are here to cover you and help bring exposure to your game. The Prep Girls Hoops Network, is a fast-growing national brand aimed at providing visibility and coverage for high school girls basketball players at all levels. We don’t rest once the high school basketball season is over. We’ll be covering: prep season, spring AAU season, summer high school ball, summer AAU, fall ball and more. In short, if basketball is happening, we’re covering it. Here’s just some of what you’ll get as a subscriber to PGH California: — Recruiting Reports. Interviews with basketball prospects of all levels, available to hundreds of coaches who are subscribed to our network throughout the country. — Event coverage. If there is a bigtime tournament or showcase happening, PGH wants to be there. — Game analysis and evaluation. — Weekly preview stories. — Extensive grassroots coverage. We hope that you’ll subscribe to Prep Girls Hoops California and find out what in-depth, round-the-clock coverage of the state’s basketball scene really looks like! — The Prep Girls Hoops team

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Everything you need to know about the comprehensive authority for high school girls basketball in California.

item.title: Who stood out at the OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp? (Part 1)
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
The Ohio Girls Basketball Report began the weekend of The Classic in Louisville, Kentucky with another outstanding exposure event. The OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp was held on Friday, May 17th at the beautiful Mid-America Sports Complex. With the usual high volume of college coaches in attendance - OGBR packed the house with top-notch talent from multiple states on the east coast.

Let's take a look at some players who caught our eye at The OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp.

[caption id="attachment_50534" align="alignleft" width="300"] Malea Bess knocked down a number of perimeter attempts and showed solid playmaking ability. (Photo Credit: Hudl)[/caption] Malea Bess - 5'7 Guard - Class of 2021 - Pickerington North  Bess is very athletic and uses that athleticism to finish around the rim with both hands. She is probably better suited in the off-guard role, as opposed to playing as the guard who would initiate the offense. She is a great 3-point shooter with a quick release and good range. Jayiona Cobbs - 5'9 Guard - Class of 2021 - Evanston Township (IL) Smooth off of the bounce with an outstanding pull-up game, Cobbs was one of the event's top performers in the Class of 2021. She is a tremendous passer and makes plays for her teammates consistently. A good 3-point shooter, Jayiona is also very explosive as a driver. She can score at all 3 levels. Elise Harden - 6'1 Forward - Class of 2020 - Columbia (GA) A good communicator who plays hard on D with very active hands, Harden has major upside. She has a solid package of post moves and does a great job of kicking out of double-teams when appropriate. She runs the floor hard in transitions and rolls hard to the rim in 1/2 court sets, when given the opportunity. [caption id="attachment_50536" align="alignright" width="300"] The drive from Michigan was worth it for Abbey Kimball. She dominated the day's 3rd session. (Photo Credit: Twitter)[/caption] Abbey Kimball - 5'10 Guard - Class of 2022 - Grand Rapids West Catholic (MI) Kimball is a long PG who creates a number of scoring opportunities off of the dribble. She can knock down the stand-still J from 3 and also uses a nice pull-up J from the mid-range. Abby had some of the most impressive court vision that we saw on the day - she got her teammates involved at a high level. She blocks a number of shots and rebounds very well for a guard. Celina Koncz - 6'0 Wing - Class of 2020 - Chippewa Koncz was on the court with a number of Division 1 prospects and she definitely stood out at times. Long and lanky - she is in the point-forward mold. It's normal to see her grab a defensive rebound and bring the ball down the court to initiate the offense. She has good court vision and can score inside and out. Celina blocked a handful of shots on the day. Addesa Miller - 5'7 Guard - Class of 2024 - Dalton Explosive in the open court - Miller is always putting pressure on defenses. Her attack mindset - whether with the ball in her hands or on the offensive glass - gets her a number of free throw attempts throughout a given game.  She is an active defender with good lateral quickness and the potential to take opposing guards out of the game completely. It will be interesting to see how her game develops as she matures. [caption id="attachment_50537" align="alignleft" width="300"] Teegan Pifher showed why a number of Division I are pursuing her services at the next level. (Photo Credit: Delaware Gazette)[/caption] Teegan Pifher - 6'1 Forward - Class of 2020 - Olentangy Liberty After recently re-opening up her recruiting process, Pifher played very well in Louisville and left the weekend with over a dozen new Division I offers. Teegan plays with a lot of energy and a constant motor. She is a good rebounder. Her offensive game should continue to develop and become more fluid at the college level - she has a very high ceiling. Sydney Snyder - 5'7 Wing - Class of 2021 - Loudonville Although she didn't have the athleticism that many of the other prospects possessed in Louisville, Snyder was certainly one of the best shooters. In a remarkable display of marksmanship - Sydney drilled her first 6 3-point attempts in her game. Her footwork is awkward, but she has a high release that does not take very long to get off. She rebounded at a high level. Brooklyn Troyer - 5'7 Guard - Class of 2021 - Waynedale Troyer - who played well at OGBR's initial exposure event of the spring in Cincinnati - had another outstanding day. She is a great jump-shooter, who can create her own shots or make things happen off of the ball. She finishes well at the rim and has a good knack for getting the ball up to the glass quickly before taller defenders can block her shots.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who played well at the OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp in Louisville, Kentucky?

item.title: Who stood out at the OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp? (Part 2)
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
The Ohio Girls Basketball Report began the weekend of The Classic in Louisville, Kentucky with another outstanding exposure event. The OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp was held on Friday, May 17th at the beautiful Mid-America Sports Complex. With the usual high volume of college coaches in attendance – OGBR packed the house with top-notch talent from multiple states on the east coast.

Let’s take a look at some players who caught our eye at The OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp.

[caption id="attachment_50560" align="alignleft" width="300"] Sydney Bourquin continues to stand out on the exposure circuit this spring. (Photo Credit: Twitter)[/caption] Sydney Bourquin - 5'9 Guard - Class of 2020 - Jonathan Alder Sydney showed some good athleticism on the day, playing in a game with some big-time prospects. She is a tall point guard with a nice finishing package, including a very impressive euro-step. She explodes off of her feet around the rim and uses her length to rebound at a high level for a perimeter player. Borquin is a solid ball-handler. Caitlin Elseser - 6'3 Post - Class of 2020 - Liberty Benton If someone's stock went up on the day/weekend it was Elseser. She left Louisville with a handful of offers after showing nice mobility and strength for someone as big and strong as her. She has tremendous hands and a soft touch from the floor and FT line. At her size, Elseser probably does need to become a better rebounder to become a double-double kid at the D1 level, but she certainly has the potential to do so. Caitlin alters a number of shots and can really change the game with her defensive efforts. Alysia Lawson - 5'7 Guard - Class of 2022 - Toledo Bowsher A point guard with great handles and a truly devastating crossover, Lawson is a creative finisher with both hands in the lane. She is super quick and does a special job of letting the game come to her by not forcing anything. Alysia can score a lot of points in a hurry. [caption id="attachment_50561" align="alignright" width="300"] Grace Mills is a dynamic scorer from all 3 levels. She is on her way to nearly 2000 career points in HS. (Photo Credit: Record Courier)[/caption] Grace Mills - 5'7 Guard - Class of 2021 - Garrettsville Garfield Many basketball fans would say that the mid-range game is a lost art, but it is an art that Grace Mills has nearly perfected. She hit a handful of pull-up jumpers off of one-dribble opportunities. Mills also showed high athleticism, finishing over much larger defenders in the paint and in transition. She needs to become a better defender, but seems to have the ability to do so down the road with some technique changes. Ashley Mullet - 5'2 Guard - Class of 2024 - Berlin Hiland Mullet seems to be heading down the all-too-familiar path of stardom and success at Berlin Hiland. She is a solid ball-handler with combo guard potential. Her jump shot is pure and although she is on the smaller end right now, she has the toughness and savvy to play with anyone. Ashley is an outstanding passer with tremendous court vision. Adison Novosel - 5'10 Wing - Class of 2021 - Revere Novosel took over her contest - scoring in a variety of ways off of the bounce and on the catch. She also rebounded at a high level and finished well around the rim with both hands. The long and lanky athlete is a good 3-point shooter. She shows signs of being an elite defender.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who played well at the OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp in Louisville, Kentucky?

item.title: Who stood out at the OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp? (Part 3)
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
The Ohio Girls Basketball Report began the weekend of The Classic in Louisville, Kentucky with another outstanding exposure event. The OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp was held on Friday, May 17th at the beautiful Mid-America Sports Complex. With the usual high volume of college coaches in attendance – OGBR packed the house with top-notch talent from multiple states on the east coast.

Let’s take a look at some players who caught our eye at The OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp.

[caption id="attachment_50567" align="alignleft" width="300"] Makira Cook is one of Ohio's top player - regardless of graduating class. (Photo Credit: Cincinnati Enquirer)[/caption] Makira Cook - 5'8 Guard - Class of 2020 - Mount Notre Dame A dead-eye 3-point shooter during her contest, Cook showed why she is a big-time Division I prospect. She has a smooth/effortless stroke that many other players would love to mimic. A good ball-handler with great court vision, she leads her team well - you can tell that other players enjoy playing with her. Makira seems to love the game and plays with a positive bounce in her step that rubs off on others. Carly Perusek - 5'9 Guard - Class of 2020 - Beaumont Perusek is a tremendous scorer of the basketball from her off-guard position. She possesses good range on her 3-point shot and has a lightning-quick release when she has her feet set. Carly is strong and athletic - she uses those tools to finish a high number of her attempts in the paint. She uses both hands well at the rim and has no problem absorbing contact to make a bucket. [caption id="attachment_50570" align="alignright" width="169"] Alana Ellis is back for her senior year at Twinsburg, where the standout should continue to draw interest from colleges of all levels. (Photo Credit: Ohio.com)[/caption] Alana Ellis - 5'11 Wing - Class of 2020 - Twinsburg Ellis seems to have great potential as an athletic prospect. She covers a ton of ground offensively with the ball in her hands. She certainly has a scorer's mentality - who could probably get her teammates involved more at times, but also can score in so many different ways. Alana has a nice runner/floater/euro finishing package around the rim. Quin Pifher - 5'11 Post - Class of 2023 - Olentangy Liberty The sister of big-time prospect Teegan Pifher, Quin is starting to make her own case as a standout on the hardwood. The long post showed flashes of dominance around the rim. As she gets stronger and continues to become more coordinated, it's easy to see how she should develop into a high-level player. Pifher has nice touch as a jump shooter and good footwork in the post. Khiara Shelburne - 5'10 Post - Class of 2021 - Butler (KY) Shelburne makes up for her lack of height in the post with her super leaping ability and athleticism. Khiara is a great rebounder who runs the floor well and comfortably finishes around the basket with both hands . She can cause havoc on the defensive end - where she gets a number of deflections, while altering many shots.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who played well at the OGBR Elite Exposure Basketball Camp in Louisville, Kentucky?

item.title: Carroll County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

Carroll County, part of the Canton-Massillon metropolitan area, was named for Charles Carroll of Carrollton - the last surviving signer of the Declaration of Independence. There are only 3 high school girls basketball programs in Carroll County (Carrollton, Conotton Valley, Malvern), but between the 3 schools, there are certainly some girls basketball players for Ohio fans to keep an eye on.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Carroll County.

Malina Moore - Carrollton - Class of 2020 Moore is an undersized forward for Carrollton - who will probably need to produce the bulk of the offensive production during the 2019-2020 season. She has a nice package of post moves on the block and goes to her up-and-under more often than not. She can shoot the mid-range J and even step out and connect on a 3-pointer occasionally if left open. Abby Laizure - Carrollton - Class of 2021 Laizure is a very good 3-point shooter who can catch fire in a hurry. She is definitely on the smaller end of the spectrum for guards, but is best suited playing off of the ball, as her catch-and-shoot game is outstanding. She is a good FT shooter. Maggie Bower - Conotton Valley - Class of 2020 Bower is a tweener with good hands. She finishes well around the rim with both hands and does a solid job of making hard one-dribble moves to the basket in half-court or on the catch in transition. She will step out and shoot the 3 - although her release is not the most fluid at this point. Sydney Lyon - Conotton Valley - Class of 2020 Lyon is one of the more natural "basketball players" in Carroll County when you watch her on the court. Sydney is a very active defender - who causes havoc and creates turnovers with deflections and steals - leading to offensive opportunities for her in the open floor. She has a nice runner/floater package and is also a solid 3-point shooter. Hope Whaley - Malvern - Class of 2020 There were nights when Whaley scored over 50% of her team's points. She is a good athlete who has experienced success in other sports and it's easy to see that athleticism translate to the basketball court. Hope does a number of things - aside from scoring the basketball, as she is a good rebounder, creates scoring opportunities for her teammates and defends hard.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Carroll County?

item.title: Ashland County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

When it comes to Ashland County - most basketball fans immediately think of the Ashland Eagles Women's Basketball Program. One of the nation's top teams on a yearly basis and National Champions just three seasons ago - the Eagles are certainly fan favorites in the area. In the high school ranks, Ashland County doesn't have any traditional powerhouses, but the Loudonville Redbirds have won 20+ games in each of the past 3 seasons.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Ashland County.

[caption id="attachment_50766" align="alignleft" width="230"] Emily Seboe is a jack-of-all trades with big-time potential at the next level. (Photo Credit: Wooster Daily Record)[/caption] Emily Seboe - 5'11 Guard - Class of 2021 - Loudonville Emily is without a doubt the area's best player on the area's best team. Already over 1000 career points, Emily has a chance to graduate as Loudonville's career leader in points, rebounds, blocked shots and 3-pointers. A point-forward, Emily is a walking double-double with walk-in-the-gym range and tremendous court vision. She scores inside and out - making it very difficult for opponents to stop her. Breena Plank - 5'7 Guard - Class of 2021 - Ashland Plank is an athletic off-guard who is a very active and impressive defender. She has high energy and a constant motor. Breena is not the best shooter - she is much more comfortable playing off of the bounce in a "slasher" role. She is tough to stop in a fast-tempo game and does a great job of converting transition opportunities in the open floor. Grace Vermilya - 5'11 Post - Class of 2021 - Loudonville In an era where a back-to-the-basket post player is extremely rare, Vermilya is advanced with her post moves. She has a nearly unstoppable left-handed sweeping hook, good drop steps with either hand and up-and-unders from both blocks. Grace can step out and shoot the ball at a high percentage from the mid-range. She was a 90% FT shooter last winter. [caption id="attachment_50767" align="alignright" width="300"] Sarah Kozik has seen her fair share of different defenses as Black River's primary ball-handler and scorer. (Photo Credit: Hudl)[/caption] Sarah Kozik - 5'5 Guard - Class of 2020 - Black River Although Black River hasn't had the strongest program during her HS career, Kozik has established herself as one of the top guards in the area. Sarah is very quick and possesses good court vision, racking up a number of assists night in and night out. She is a good 3-point shooter and solid defender. Kaylee Friesen - 5'8 Forward - Class of 2021 - Ashland Friesen is an undersized post who seems to get better every time that she takes the floor. An all-district selection as a sophomore, Kaylee has double-double potential. She is a good leaper who has a nose for the basketball and the ability to block and alter a high number of shots. Annie Seboe - 5'11 Forward - Class of 2020 - Loudonville Annie is one of the top shooters in the area - at nearly 50% from beyond the arc during her junior year. She is a good rebounder and outstanding post defender. Seboe is one of the vocal leaders at Loudonville, constantly communicating on the defensive end. [caption id="attachment_50768" align="alignleft" width="300"] Sydney Snyder is ready for a breakout junior season. (Photo Credit: Hudl)[/caption] Sydney Snyder - 5'8 Wing - Class of 2021 - Loudonville Snyder is another tremendous shooter. With nearly 100 3-pointers through her first two years of high school basketball, Sydney is on pace to graduate as one of Ashland County's top 3-point shooters of all-time. She is improving as a rebounder and has developed into a player who may inherit a "point-forward" role over the next 2 seasons. Cacie Stalnaker - 5'4 Guard - Class of 2021 - Mapleton One of the bright spots for Mapleton this season, Stalnaker is a good athlete who excels during the fall and spring seasons as well. She uses her quickness and top-notch conditioning to attack and put pressure on defenses. She is a good finisher at the rim and can also make jumpers from the mid-range and perimeter.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Ashland County?

item.title: Henry County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

Henry County was organized in 1834 and named for Patrick Henry - the famous Founding Father who proclaimed "give me liberty or give me death" to the Second Virginia Convention in 1775. There have been some outstanding girls basketball teams in Henry County. With the number of standout players returning in Henry County's 4 high schools, next year should be no different.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Henry County.

Shae Pedroza - 5'5 Guard - Napoleon - Class of 2020 An accurate 3-point shooter with great range, Pedroza has combo-guard ability, although she seems to feel much more natural with the ball in her hands at the 1. A good ball-handler who creates a number of scoring opportunities for her teammates, Shae will routinely defender the other team's top guard. [caption id="attachment_51412" align="alignleft" width="212"] There are few teams that have had success stopping Caely Ressler from Napoleon. (Photo Credit: Northwest Signal)[/caption] Caely Ressler - 5'11 Guard - Napoleon - Class of 2021 Ressler is a mismatch nightmare for opposing defenses. She uses her long arms and nearly 6-foot frame to beat defenders with a great first step, while also shooting the ball well from the perimeter and mixing it up on the block. Ressler grabs her fair share of rebounds and blocks a number of shots from her off-guard spot. She is a nice college prospect with size and the ability to add muscle down the road. McKenzie Vance -  5'10 Forward - Patrick Henry - Class of 2021 Vance is a long forward who does a majority of her work around the rim. She is long and athletic - she uses that length and athleticism to rebound the basketball at a high rate. McKenzie should be a double-double candidate on a nightly basis throughout her last two years of high school. Audrey Sonnenberg - 5'8 Guard - Patrick Henry - Class of 2020 Sonnenberg is a very good multi-sport athlete at Patrick Henry - who in addition to her exploits in the fall and spring - does a number of good things on the hardwood for the Patriots. She is a good shooter who does a solid job of handling the ball. Audrey is also money from the FT line and scores a number of her points there throughout a given game. [caption id="attachment_51414" align="alignright" width="209"] Justine Eis could develop into a dominant force by the time her career at Holgate is over. (Photo Credit: Northwest Signal)[/caption] Justine Eis - 5'11 Post -  Holgate - Class of 2022 One of the stronger posts in the area, Eis bust onto the scene and had a very successful freshmen year as one of Holgate's top players. She has a nice set of post moves and is tough to stop when she gets her hands on the ball around the rim. Justine does a good job of carving out space and creating scoring opportunities in the paint. Cassidy Chapa - 5'6 Guard - Liberty Center - Class of 2021 Chapa is a tremendous scorer from her off-guard spot. She is good defender on the ball and creates a number of scoring plays from steals and deflections off of the ball. Cassidy is a good shooter who also has the ability to dish out a number of assists and grab a handful of rebounds. She is comfortable finishing with both hands at the rim. Taylor Strock - 5'8 Guard - Napoleon - Class of 2021   Taylor does a lot of things right. She comes off of screens and score the basketball from all 3 levels. She is a good 3-point shooter and has no problem getting her shot off - due to her lightning quick release. Strock has a great package of dribble moves and finishes with runners/floaters routinely. She is an active defender who gets a number of lay-ups from her own pressure.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Henry County?

item.title: Lake County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

On the shores of Lake Erie, Lake County is home to one of Ohio's most diverse public park systems. It is also home to one of the state's deepest and most diverse groups of basketball talent. Although Lake County features no "booming metropolis" - it certainly has a wide variety of high schools. Spanning multiple divisions in the OHSAA and featuring a very talented list of kids, Lake County has a number of standouts - who made this list very tough to narrow down.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Lake County.

[caption id="attachment_51598" align="alignleft" width="300"] Destiny Leo doesn't have much left to prove at Eastlake North. The 1st Team All-Ohioan and D1 commit will be returning in the winter for her senior season. (Photo Credit: Eastlake North)[/caption] Destiny Leo - 5'10 Guard - Eastlake North - Class of 2020 Leo is the gold star of this bunch. One of the leading scorers in the entire state of Ohio during the 2018-2019 season, the Cleveland State commit led her Eastlake North team to an undefeated regular season and a run to the Regional Finals before finally falling to GlenOak. Destiny has great size on the perimeter, as well as a skill set that makes it look extremely easy as she scores from all 3 levels. She is an outstanding physical and is one of the toughest and most mentally unflappable players on the court night-in and night-out. Madison Cloonan - 5'9 Guard - Cornerstone Christian - Class of 2020 Cloonan was the best player this year for D4 state powerhouse Cornerstone Christian. Madison does so many things well on the basketball court. She can initiate the offense, defend top players on the other team, shoot the 3-ball, create scoring opportunities for her teammates and even add 6-8 rebounds a night. Riley Stopp - 5'10 Wing - Cornerstone Christian - Class of 2021 Stopp - the daughter of Cornerstone head coach and former Cleveland State player Lisa Stopp - was her team's leading scorer last winter sophomore. The lengthy forward is strong and physical. Riley plays with a high motor and creates mismatches at will with her ability to score on the block or step out and knock down shots. [caption id="attachment_51600" align="alignright" width="300"] Grace Wolf had a great freshmen year at Kirtland. (Photo Credit: Ohio Varsity)[/caption] Grace Wolfe - 5'11 Forward - Kirtland - Class of 2022 A 3-sport standout during her freshmen year at Kirtland - Grace was the goalie for the team's outstanding soccer team and has been a key contributor for the softball squad in the spring. However, she may have made the biggest splash on the basketball court. The athletic post was a double-double machine who also showed the ability to block a number of shots around the basket. She has big-time star-potential. Riley Montagner - 5'6 Guard - Madison - Class of 2022 Montagner burst onto the scene as a spunky ball-dominant guard with the ability to put a team on her back. As part of a freshmen-laden lineup at Madison, Montagner was often faced with the other team's best defender (sometimes 3 years older), but it never phased her. Riley is probably at her best right now when she is attacking the rim and playing in an up-tempo game. She is a solid defender. Stephanie Martin - 5'5 Guard - Wickliffe - Class of 2020  Martin is already a 1000 point career scorer at Wickliffe, where she also became the school's all-time leading scorer during her junior season. A hard-nosed player - Stephanie loves to attack defenses by getting in the paint at will. She shoots a high number of FT's and puts the opposition in foul trouble at a high rate. She can knock down the 3 when teams sag off of her and she has no problem finishing through contact at the rim. [caption id="attachment_51601" align="alignleft" width="300"] Abby Carter can shoot it with the best of them. (Photo Credit: Ohio Varsity)[/caption] Abby Carter - 5'10 Guard - Eastlake North - Class of 2021 Carter played her best in some of Eastlake North's biggest games. She is a dead-eye 3-point shooter with walk-in-the-gym range and the length and smooth release to get her shot off at any time. Abby is a great passer with tremendous court vision. She should be a very solid college player at the D1 level. Madyson Hacking - 5'6 Guard - Perry - Class of 2021 Hacking is a strong guard who plays much bigger than her size would suggest. She is a true jump shooter with great form and legitimate range from 3-point land. Madyson is also comfortable going to step-back jumper or pull-up jumper when she is creating off of the bounce. She is an active defender who causes havoc on that end of the court. Elle Infalvi - 5'6 Guard - Perry - Class of 2021 A tremendous shooter - Infalvi has a quick release that seems effortless. Often times, she is face-guarded, as teams don't want the playmaker to have the ball in her hands or get any clean looks at the rim. Elle is currently better in catch-and-shoot situations than she is off of the bounce. She clearly has a very bright future at Perry and beyond.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Lake County?

item.title: Grassroots Preview: OK Swarm 17U BlueStar David
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded: We got the opportunity to watch an exciting matchup between the OK Swarm 17U BlueStar-David and Oklahoma Arsenal in the live period in May. The Swarm established their energy early in the game and often. This would continue to be a theme for the Swarm throughout the whole tournament. The game plan was clear with activity on defense that would fuel their offense. Mackenzie Crusoe, a key contributor to this cause, she was busy snatching steals, digging down on help defense and creating instant offense all game long. On the offensive end she produced as well knocking down multiple shots in corner. Mackenzie was not alone on offense,  as the Swarm did a great job of making the extra pass and trusting their teammates showing unique team chemistry. The Oklahoma Arsenal struggled to keep up with the pace of the Swarm as they switched to a zone defense in attempts to slow the game down.  Unfortunately for them, this did not last long. Mackenzie Crusoe, Lexie Davis and Katie King continued to shoot the ball well and push the pace on both ends of the floor. Given the rare chance they didn’t make the shot, Olivia Clayton was down in the paint working hard. Snagging rebounds, creating second chance points, the long and athletic forward is extremely fun to watch for any basketball fanatic.   Player Spotlight:  #21 Mackenzie Crusoe, Junior, 5'7, Guard, Choctaw HS -Active defender -Spot up shooter -Ability to drive and finish at the rim   Key Players: #10 Katie King, Junior, 5'4, Point Guard, Harrah HS #0 Olivia Clayton, Junior, 6'3, Forward/Center, Checotah HS #34 Lexie Davis, Junior, 5'7, Guard, Christian Heritage Academy, Harding Committ

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: We got the opportunity to watch an exciting matchup between the OK Swarm 17U BlueStar-David and Oklahoma Arsenal.

item.title: Player Spotlight Breakdown: Taniya Tease
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
In player spotlight breakdown, we have various writers and witness who analyze and breakdown the game of players. They may catching a game in play, a coach waiting for the next game, an official that has officiated many game, either way, many of these observations come from witness the play of each player on multiple occasions and in heavy positive ways. The breakdown analyzes the game from a perspective. This Player Spotlight Breakdown. Player Spotlight: TANIYA TEASE  

#15 Junior, 5’8, Guard, Tulsa Edison HS

  Witness much of her play in the second live period in May. The Arsenal struggled to get anything going largely due to turnovers and poor rebounding. They had a couple of bright moments thanks to #15, Taniya Tease. She showed signs of being a real threat on the offensive end. Not only scoring, but in a mature fashion, as she used pump fakes around the basket, as well as on the perimeter prior to pulling of for mid-range jumpers. Refreshingly, she even sank a floater which seems to be a lost art for many players. Her growth will be exciting to watch. She could evolve into a great combo guard as she continues to develop her outside shot. Understanding basketball IQ will be critical as well, knowing where the help defenders are coming from as well as identifying shooters on the floor. She seems as if she already knows how to get her spots and make things happen. From observation she is can be a dangerous PNR player with shooters in the corner.   Player Spotlight: -Aggressive scorer -Nice pull-up jumper -Good finisher around the rim

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Witness much of her play in the second live period in May, some bright moments thanks to #15, Taniya Tease.

item.title: Geauga County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

Forbes Magazine has named Geauga County as one of the best places in America to raise a family. Geauga County is named for the Onondaga word meaning raccoon. About 20% of Geauga County's population is Amish - one of the largest Amish populations in the region. Geauga County is also home to a number of successful girls basketball programs - featuring some outstanding players.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Geauga County.

Lexi Boyk - 5'6 Guard - Berkshire - Class of 2020 Boyk is better known for her exploits on the soccer field, where she is a big-time prospect and the track, where she has had major success in multiple events, but she is also a very good point guard on the hardwood. Lexi has a good court presence and does a nice job of getting her team into the correct offensive sets. She has tremendous quick and is a good 3-point shooter when her feet are set. [caption id="attachment_52503" align="alignleft" width="300"] Chardon fans cannot wait to see Halle Landies back on the court for her senior season. (Photo Credit: Ohio Varsity)[/caption] Halle Landies - 5'8 Guard - Chardon - Class of 2020  Landies is recovering from an ACL injury, but area followers haven't forgotten about her. She is a dynamic scorer from all 3 levels of the offensive end. She has a nice euro-step and finishes around the rim well (mostly with her right hand). She is comfortable in the mid-range game with a nice pull-up jumper. She also hits a high percentage of her attempts from deep - using a balance of catch-and-shoot and step-back opportunities. Catara DeJarnette - 5'5 Guard - Kenston - Class of 2022 The only player on our list from the Class of 2022, DeJarnette burst onto the scene during her freshmen year, which was certainly one to remember. She is a tremendous shooter with good range from 3. She is also athletic enough to get to the rim and strong enough to finish through contact.  Catara has great court vision and the potential to be a lockdown defender on the ball. Emma Liberatore - 5'8 Wing - Notre Dame Cathedral Latin - Class of 2020  Emma has been a double-double machine from her "3" spot for Catedral Latin. She is tough as nails on the boards and scores a number of her points after getting offensive rebounds. She runs the floor well and does a good job of flashing to open spots at appropriate times and using open space wisely off of the ball. Liberatore is in the "slasher" mode - she is much more comfortable finishing in the paint than she is connecting from the perimeter. [caption id="attachment_52504" align="alignright" width="300"] Nikki Ehrbar has had two highly productive seasons at West Geauga. (Photo Credit: Chagrin Valley Today)[/caption] Nikki Ehrbar - 5'8 Guard - West Geauga - Class of 2021 A high-energy kid, Ehrbar is a tough defender on the ball and off of the ball, who causes havoc and creates a number of deflections and steals that lead to easy points. She battles on the glass and serves as a decent playmaker - putting her teammates in some great situations to score. Nikki is one of the top 2021's in the area. Athena Hocevar - 6'0 Guard - West Geauga - Class of 2021 One of the top prospects in the area, Hocevar has tremendous length and athleticism. After transferring from Gilmour Academy, she miss a majority of her sophomore campaign, but not after showing the elite potential that we know her for. Athena is tough in transition, she is a good 3-point shooter, solid defender and above-average rebounder.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Geauga County?

item.title: Portage County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

Portage County is named for the portage - or path where items are regularly carried between bodies of water - between the Cuyahoga River and the Tuscarawas River.  Kent State University and Hiram College are both located in Portage County - along with the old Aurora Train Station. Portage County is also home to a number of outstanding basketball players - including one of the top-ranked 2021's in the country.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Portage County.

[caption id="attachment_52516" align="alignleft" width="300"] Basketball fans everywhere enjoy watching Shyanne Sellers compete at such a high level. (Photo Credit: Akron Beacon Journal)[/caption] Shyanne Sellers - 6'2 Guard - Aurora - Class of 2021 There aren't too many things that Shyanne Sellers struggles with on a basketball court. Sellers has a quick release and outstanding range on her jumper. She is a tremendous leaper who uses that athleticism to make pull-up jumpers or finish around the rim. She has a nice post-up game that she utilizes against solid defenders. A good rebounder on both ends, Sellers is also a very active defender off of the ball. When you watch her play, it's no surprise to know that she is one of the top players in the country for the Class of 2021. Maria Sziva - 5'8 Forward - Field - Class of 2020 Sziva was an All-Ohioan this year for Field. A true "slasher" - Maria does a lot of the little things right. She gets offensive rebounds and loose balls, makes her lay-ups and racks up a number of deflections. She finishes well at the rim with both hands and does a nice job of playing through contact from larger defenders - as she uses her body to protect the ball. [caption id="attachment_52517" align="alignright" width="170"] Grace Mills is one of the top players in the PTC. (Photo Credit: Record Courier)[/caption] Grace Mills - 5'7 Guard - Garfield - Class of 2021 After two years at Garfield, Mills is already a 2-time All-Ohio selection who is closing in on 1000 career points.  Grace is a prototypical 2-guard who can score the ball at will. She is dynamic in the mid-range, with as pure of a pull-up jumper as you find in the high school game. Grace's athleticism benefits her in transition, where she is extremely fun to watch in the open court. Jenna Smith - 6'0 Post - Garfield - Class of 2022 In an era when back-to-the-basket post players are becoming less common by the day, Smith has the potential to be an elite post-up kid. That's not to say that she can't score off of the bounce or step out and make mid-range jumpers - because she can, but Jenna has the frame and skill-set to be a 20 PPG-12 RPG kid by the time she leaves Garfield. Avery Robinson - 5'10 Forward - Ravenna - Class of 2020 Robinson is a good 3-point shooter from everywhere behind the arc. She has a quick release and solid range. Avery has great court vision and creates a number of scoring opportunities for her teammates, using her long frame to make passes over the defense. Rachel Neer - 5'6 Wing - Southeast - Class of 2021 Rachel was a key contributor this year for the district champions from Southeast. Her best attribute is the level of effort that she gives. She is a tweener - who doesn't possess true ball-handling or shooting skills like a top guard - but she can defend top guards on the other teams. Neer keeps possessions alive and gets every 50/50 ball for her team. She is at her best when she is attacking the rim and putting pressure on defenses. Haylee Kachner - 5'8 Guard - Waterloo - Class of 2020 Simply put, Kachner can score the basketball. A strong and athletic off-guard, she is a streaky shooter from 3, who also has a nice 1-dribble attack game after she makes a few jumpers. Haylee is a good rebounder - who scores a number of her points from offensive stick backs.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Portage County?

item.title: Harrison County Hoopers
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
Throughout this off-season, the Prep Girls Hoops staff will be taking a close look at some of the top underclassmen across all of Ohio’s 88 counties.

When we decided to write about some of the top underclassmen in each of Ohio's 88 counties, we knew that we were in for a surprise or two along the way. We knew that Holmes County - one of the first counties that we featured - had 2 tremendous high school girls basketball programs in Berlin Hiland and Millersburg West Holmes. We also knew that it would be very difficult to narrow our list down for Cuyahoga County (we have yet to do this) and its 70+ high schools. We were surprised to learn that Harrison County only features one high school girls basketball program - The Harrison Central Huskies. Although our list for Harrison County may not be as long as all of the others - it is important that we give their ballers the same profile as the rest of the counties during this off-season.

Let’s take a look at a number of talented underclassmen from Harrison County.

McKayla Dunkle - 6'0 Forward - Harrison Central - Class of 2022 Dunkle has a bright future ahead of her as a potential centerpiece at Harrison Central. She is a long and athletic forward with room to add some muscle to her frame as she matures and gets older. McKayla is a good rebounder who does a nice job of getting off of her feet around the rim. She can finish with both hands around the basket offensively. Britton Positano - 5'6 Guard - Harrison Central - Class of 2021 Although she can handle the ball, Positano is probably best as an off-guard - utilizing her tremendous ability to knock down open looks from 3-point range. A good 3-sport athlete who uses that athleticism on the defensive end of the floor at Harrison Central, Britton is going to have to pick up some of the slack offensively as her basketball squad tries to replace a lot of scoring in the graduating senior class.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Who are some of the top underclassmen in Harrison County?

item.title: More Travel Dates! #PGHOK
item.dc:creator: prepgirlshoopsstaff
item.content:encoded:
The travel season is here and at Prep Girls Hoop Oklahoma, we understand and believe that basketball is an all year around sport in which we aim to provide coverage for all high school girls basketball players. The first evaluation period in April has passed us as we everyone finishes up for the next live period from the month of May. We saw many awesome and positive performances from so many girls and teams off of the first two live period. We listed where many known teams and players played in live periods in past articles. Some teams featured were the Arkansas Banshees,THSS Mavs Elite,Below The Rim, OK PWP, OK Swarm,OKC Lions Elite to name a few. Excited to check out more teams in the next live period, here are some upcoming events a few Oklahoma teams to be on the lookout for and some of the players that make up their rosters!  

Future Elite

  Location: Oklahoma City, Oklahoma Number of teams: 1 team Oldest Team Competition: 17 and Under Some Players:  Albony Bryles(2023) Brink MS, Brooklyn Haywood(2022) Southmoore HS, Margizinee Tuner(2022) John Marshall HS, Kayla Nealy(2021) Southmoore High HS, Jaylin McAlister(2023) Del City HS, Adrian Richmond(2023), Leta Rae Gunner(2022) Western Heights HS, Linda Ann Gunner(2022) Western Heights HS,  Faith Appiah(2023) Edmond Memorial HS

Washington HS, Darrian Jordan(2021) Sand Springs HS, April Vann-Jackson (2022) Broken Arrow Freshman Academy, Caroline Greer(2022) Holland Hall, Emmalee Osborn(2023) Sapulpa Jr HS, Kailee Deffebaugh(2022) Memorial HS in Frisco, TX, Kiara Brown(2022) Jenks HS, Makayla Adams(2021) Broken Arrow HS, Noel Warrior(2022) Edmond Santa Fe HS, Raegan McQuarters(2023) Sapulpa Jr HS, Taleyah Jones(2022) Tulsa Union HS, Tyla Wilson(2021) Booker T. Washington.           *Please Contact us for updates to schedule
